CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW in Criminal matters of DATE , to which both GPE and GPE are parties , contains a safe - conduct clause . That LAW reads as follows :

“ CARDINAL . A witness or expert , whatever his nationality , appearing on a summons before the judicial authorities of the requesting ORG shall not be prosecuted or detained or subjected to any other restriction of his personal liberty in the territory of that ORG in respect of acts or convictions anterior to his departure from the territory of the requested ORG .

CARDINAL . A person , whatever his nationality , summoned before the judicial authorities of the requesting ORG to answer for acts forming the subject of proceedings against him , shall not be prosecuted or detained or subjected to any other restriction of his personal liberty for acts or convictions anterior to his departure from the territory of the requested ORG and not specified in the summons .

CARDINAL . The immunity provided for in this article shall cease when the witness or expert or prosecuted person , having had for DATE from the date when his presence is no longer required by the judicial authorities an opportunity of leaving , has nevertheless remained in the territory , or having left it , has returned . ”

CARDINAL . A person being prosecuted shall enjoy no safe conduct in respect of the offences specified in the summons .
CARDINAL . The safe conduct provided for in paragraph CARDINAL shall cease when the person leaves GPE and at DATE after he is permitted to leave by the summoning authorities . ”
